com.hotmail.joatin37.jcore.language

Class Lang

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hotmail.joatin37.jcore.language.Lang

  • public final class Lang
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is made to make localization easier for developers

    When you request to get a sentence or to send one for the first time it will automatically load the language files inside you plugin. It will search for files inside you lang directory. Your lang files names must be a IETF standard language tag with one region subtag. Examples are en-US, en-EN, or sv-SE. However it will only search for tags that have been added to a list inside this class. So if you wan't to add a language that isn't yet suport please leave a note to the developer and he wil add it as soon as possible.

    In the case that a language tag you plugin requests is missing in one of your lnaguage files, JCore will send a massege to the console with the tag, plugin, and the language used.

    Author:
    Joatin

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULTLANGAUGE

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULTLANGAUGE
        The default language for all plugins. This is currently "en-US". All plugins must have this language.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FILEENDING

        public static final java.lang.String FILEENDING
        The file ending for language files. This is equal to ".lang".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUPORTEDLANGS

        public static final java.lang.String[] SUPORTEDLANGS
        This is a list of all language tags, following the IETF standard with one region tag, that this class will try to load from each plugin. If you wan't to add a language that is missing here please contact the developer and he will add it as soon as possible.

        The current tags in the list are:

        en-US, se-SV

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lang

        public Lang(Core core)
        Used to set JCore reference inside your class. If you use this it wont have any effect.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the JCore passed was null
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getPlayerMessageSentence

        public static java.lang.String[] getPlayerMessageSentence(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin,
                                          java.lang.String tag,
                                          org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity,
                                          org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                                          org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Returns a String array with lines that is equal to one full line in the chat. This might be usefull if you want to do something more with the message before sending it.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin requesting the sentence
        tag - The tag of the sentence requested.
        entity - The entity to replace the entity tag with
        player - The player to replace the player tag with
        block - The block to replace the block tag with
        Returns:
        A String array with lines that are equal to one full line in the chat
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        JavaPlugin, Entity, OfflinePlayer, Block

      • getConsoleMessageSentence

        public static java.lang.String getConsoleMessageSentence(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin,
                                         java.lang.String tag,
                                         org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity,
                                         org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                                         org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Returns the sentence requested without colors and bold, italic etc. This is more suitable for the console. This method is usefull if you want to edit the message more. Otherwise its suggest that you use the methods for sending the message directly.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin requesting the message
        tag - The tag of the sentence to get
        entity - The entity to replace the entity tag with
        player - The player to replace the player tag with
        block - The block to replace the block tag with
        Returns:
        Returns a message suitable for the console
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        JavaPlugin, Entity, OfflinePlayer, Block

                                         org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                                         org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Returns the sentence requested without colors and bold, italic etc. This is more suitable for the console. This method is usefull if you want to edit the message more. Otherwise its suggest that you use the methods for sending the message directly.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin requesting the message
        tag - The tag of the sentence to get
        player - The player to replace the player tag with
        block - The block to replace the block tag with
        Returns:
        Returns a message suitable for the console
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        JavaPlugin, OfflinePlayer, Block
